Onsite

Job Description

At Raytheon, the foundation of everything we do is rooted in our values and a higher calling – to help our nation and allies defend freedoms and deter aggression. We bring the strength of more than 100 years of experience and renowned engineering expertise to meet the needs of today’s mission and stay ahead of tomorrow’s threat. Our team solves tough, meaningful problems that create a safer, more secure world.

Job Summary:

We value diverse skills and experience, so don’t hold back. Your qualification could add tremendous value to our team. Our customers come from all different backgrounds, and so do our employees. If you’re passionate about what you could accomplish here, we’d love to hear from you.

This position is for a technician to perform final assembly of energetic sections building large scale missiles. Applicant must be mechanically gifted, demonstrate attention to detail and safety, and provide strategic and critical products to our war fighters.

Responsibilities to Anticipate:

Perform assembly, modification, and checkout of ordnance weapon systems. Handle warheads, pyrotechnic devices, and complete ordnance weapons systems. Work with computer systems and applications. Perform hardware movement in factory. Follow all documented processes and procedures involving assembly and focus on proper material handling is always adhered to. Willing to work with explosive items. Ability to operate pneumatic and manual tools. Capable of using manual torque tools, torquing values more than 250-foot pounds. Follow detailed work instructions and detailed processes to ensure hardware conformance. Support and champion Lean Manufacturing in all processes and areas of responsibility. Participates in meetings to acquire knowledge necessary to assist in continuance of production operations. Provide work assignments and instruction to team member operators as needed. Provides leadership to other team members during completion of assigned tasks. The above includes but is not limited to making sure that all documented processes and procedures involving assembly and a focus on proper material handling are adhered to. 

Qualifications You Must Have:

High School Diploma or equivalent (GED)The ability to obtain and maintain a US security clearance prior to the start date. U.S. citizenship is required as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance. 

Qualifications We Value:

Experience in assembly or related field. Experience to operate forklift, walker stacker, pallet jack, and other equipment normally associated with loading and unloading trucks. Work outside to load and unload materials year-round. Ability to obtain and have two (2) years’ experience utilizing a class “A” Commercial Driver’s License (CDL) with vehicle and hazardous material endorsement. Ability to obtain a DOT medical examiner’s certificate. Physical warehousing and inventory control experience. DoD SECRET or higher security clearance. Hazmat Certification with Hazmat EndorsementHazmat Waste GeneratorForklift Operator CertificationIPC-A-610 CIS certificate or IPC-A-610 CIT certificateIPC/WHMA-A-620 CIS certificate or IPC/WHMA-A-620 CIT certificateIPC J-STD-001 CIS certificate or IPC-J-STD-001 CIT certificateMaterial Handling Equipment (MHE) Certification

What We Offer:

Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer a robust total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement, and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the superior benefits we offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance, and child/adult backup care.

Hired applicants may be eligible for benefits, including but not limited to, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(k) match, flexible spending accounts, flexible work schedules, employee assistance program, Employee Scholar Program, parental leave, paid time off, and holidays. Specific benefits are dependent upon the specific business unit as well as whether or not the position is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement.

Hired applicants may be eligible for annual short-term and/or long-term incentive compensation programs depending on the level of the position and whether or not it is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement. Payments under these annual programs are not guaranteed and are dependent upon a variety of factors including, but not limited to, individual performance, business unit performance, and/or the company’s performance.

This role is a U.S.-based role. If the successful candidate resides in a U.S. territory, the appropriate pay structure and benefits will apply.

RTX anticipates the application window closing approximately 40 days from the date the notice was posted. However, factors such as candidate flow and business necessity may require RTX to shorten or extend the application window.

RTX is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.
